Moreover the word<S>1697</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S> came to me, saying<S>559</S>,
Go<S>1980</S> and cry<S>7121</S> in the ears<S>241</S> of Jerusalem<S>3389</S>, saying<S>559</S>, Thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>; I remember<S>2142</S> thee, the kindness<S>2617</S> of thy youth<S>5271</S>, the love<S>160</S> of thine espousals<S>3623</S>, when thou wentest<S>3212</S> after<S>310</S> me in the wilderness<S>4057</S>, in a land<S>776</S> that was not sown<S>2232</S>. <sup>thee: or, for thy sake</sup>
Israel<S>3478</S> was holiness<S>6944</S> unto the LORD<S>3068</S>, and the firstfruits<S>7225</S> of his increase<S>8393</S>: all that devour<S>398</S> him shall offend<S>816</S>; evil<S>7451</S> shall come<S>935</S> upon them, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
Hear<S>8085</S> ye the word<S>1697</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>, O house<S>1004</S> of Jacob<S>3290</S>, and all the families<S>4940</S> of the house<S>1004</S> of Israel<S>3478</S>:
Thus saith<S>559</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, What iniquity<S>5766</S> have your fathers<S>1</S> found<S>4672</S> in me, that they are gone far<S>7368</S> from me, and have walked<S>3212</S> after<S>310</S> vanity<S>1892</S>, and are become vain<S>1891</S>?
Neither said<S>559</S> they, Where is the LORD<S>3068</S> that brought us up<S>5927</S> out of the land<S>776</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>, that led<S>3212</S> us through the wilderness<S>4057</S>, through a land<S>776</S> of deserts<S>6160</S> and of pits<S>7745</S>, through a land<S>776</S> of drought<S>6723</S>, and of the shadow of death<S>6757</S>, through a land<S>776</S> that no man<S>376</S> passed through<S>5674</S>, and where no man<S>120</S> dwelt<S>3427</S>?
And I brought<S>935</S> you into a plentiful<S>3759</S> country<S>776</S>, to eat<S>398</S> the fruit<S>6529</S> thereof and the goodness<S>2898</S> thereof; but when ye entered<S>935</S>, ye defiled<S>2930</S> my land<S>776</S>, and made<S>7760</S> mine heritage<S>5159</S> an abomination<S>8441</S>. <sup>a plentiful: or, the land of Carmel</sup>
The priests<S>3548</S> said<S>559</S> not, Where is the LORD<S>3068</S>? and they that handle<S>8610</S> the law<S>8451</S> knew<S>3045</S> me not: the pastors<S>7462</S> also transgressed<S>6586</S> against me, and the prophets<S>5030</S> prophesied<S>5012</S> by Baal<S>1168</S>, and walked<S>1980</S> after<S>310</S> things that do not profit<S>3276</S>.
Wherefore I will yet plead<S>7378</S> with you, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>, and with your children's<S>1121</S> children<S>1121</S> will I plead<S>7378</S>.
For pass over<S>5674</S> the isles<S>339</S> of Chittim<S>3794</S>, and see<S>7200</S>; and send<S>7971</S> unto Kedar<S>6938</S>, and consider<S>995</S> diligently<S>3966</S>, and see<S>7200</S> if there be such a thing. <sup>over: or, over to</sup>
Hath a nation<S>1471</S> changed<S>3235</S> their gods<S>430</S>, which are yet no gods<S>430</S>? but my people<S>5971</S> have changed<S>4171</S> their glory<S>3519</S> for that which doth not profit<S>3276</S>.
Be astonished<S>8074</S>, O ye heavens<S>8064</S>, at this, and be horribly afraid<S>8175</S>, be ye very<S>3966</S> desolate<S>2717</S>, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
For my people<S>5971</S> have committed<S>6213</S> two<S>8147</S> evils<S>7451</S>; they have forsaken<S>5800</S> me the fountain<S>4726</S> of living<S>2416</S> waters<S>4325</S>, and hewed them out<S>2672</S> cisterns<S>877</S>, broken<S>7665</S> cisterns<S>877</S>, that can hold<S>3557</S> no water<S>4325</S>.
Is Israel<S>3478</S> a servant<S>5650</S>? is he a homeborn<S>1004</S> <S>3211</S> slave? why<S>4069</S> is he spoiled<S>957</S>? <sup>spoiled: Heb. become a spoil?</sup>
The young lions<S>3715</S> roared<S>7580</S> upon him, and yelled<S>5414</S> <S>6963</S>, and they made<S>7896</S> his land<S>776</S> waste<S>8047</S>: his cities<S>5892</S> are burned<S>3341</S> without inhabitant<S>3427</S>. <sup>yelled: Heb. gave out their voice</sup>
Also the children<S>1121</S> of Noph<S>5297</S> and Tahapanes<S>8471</S> have broken<S>7462</S> the crown of thy head<S>6936</S>. <sup>have: or, feed on thy crown</sup>
Hast thou not procured<S>6213</S> this unto thyself, in that thou hast forsaken<S>5800</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S>, when<S>6256</S> he led<S>3212</S> thee by the way<S>1870</S>?
And now what hast thou to do in the way<S>1870</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>, to drink<S>8354</S> the waters<S>4325</S> of Sihor<S>7883</S>? or what hast thou to do in the way<S>1870</S> of Assyria<S>804</S>, to drink<S>8354</S> the waters<S>4325</S> of the river<S>5104</S>?
Thine own wickedness<S>7451</S> shall correct<S>3256</S> thee, and thy backslidings<S>4878</S> shall reprove<S>3198</S> thee: know<S>3045</S> therefore and see<S>7200</S> that it is an evil<S>7451</S> thing and bitter<S>4751</S>, that thou hast forsaken<S>5800</S> the LORD<S>3068</S> thy God<S>430</S>, and that my fear<S>6345</S> is not in thee, saith<S>5002</S> the Lord<S>136</S> GOD<S>3069</S> of hosts<S>6635</S>.
For of old time<S>5769</S> I have broken<S>7665</S> thy yoke<S>5923</S>, and burst<S>5423</S> thy bands<S>4147</S>; and thou saidst<S>559</S>, I will not transgress<S>5674</S> <S>5647</S>; when upon every high<S>1364</S> hill<S>1389</S> and under every green<S>7488</S> tree<S>6086</S> thou wanderest<S>6808</S>, playing the harlot<S>2181</S>. <sup>transgress: or, serve</sup>
Yet I had planted<S>5193</S> thee a noble vine<S>8321</S>, wholly a right<S>571</S> seed<S>2233</S>: how then art thou turned<S>2015</S> into the degenerate plant<S>5494</S> of a strange<S>5237</S> vine<S>1612</S> unto me?
For though thou wash<S>3526</S> thee with nitre<S>5427</S>, and take thee much<S>7235</S> soap<S>1287</S>, yet thine iniquity<S>5771</S> is marked<S>3799</S> before<S>6440</S> me, saith<S>5002</S> the Lord<S>136</S> GOD<S>3069</S>.
How canst thou say<S>559</S>, I am not polluted<S>2930</S>, I have not gone<S>1980</S> after<S>310</S> Baalim<S>1168</S>? see<S>7200</S> thy way<S>1870</S> in the valley<S>1516</S>, know<S>3045</S> what thou hast done<S>6213</S>: thou art a swift<S>7031</S> dromedary<S>1072</S> traversing<S>8308</S> her ways<S>1870</S>; <sup>thou art: or, O swift dromedary</sup>
A wild ass<S>6501</S> used<S>3928</S> to the wilderness<S>4057</S>, that snuffeth up<S>7602</S> the wind<S>7307</S> at her pleasure<S>185</S> <S>5315</S>; in her occasion<S>8385</S> who can turn her away<S>7725</S>? all they that seek<S>1245</S> her will not weary<S>3286</S> themselves; in her month<S>2320</S> they shall find<S>4672</S> her. <sup>A wild: or, O wild ass, etc</sup> <sup>used: Heb. taught</sup> <sup>her pleasure: Heb. the desire of her heart</sup> <sup>turn: or, reverse it?</sup>
Withhold<S>4513</S> thy foot<S>7272</S> from being unshod<S>3182</S>, and thy throat<S>1627</S> from thirst<S>6773</S>: but thou saidst<S>559</S>, There is no hope<S>2976</S>: no; for I have loved<S>157</S> strangers<S>2114</S>, and after<S>310</S> them will I go<S>3212</S>. <sup>There: or, Is the case desperate?</sup>
As the thief<S>1590</S> is ashamed<S>1322</S> when he is found<S>4672</S>, so is the house<S>1004</S> of Israel<S>3478</S> ashamed<S>3001</S>; they, their kings<S>4428</S>, their princes<S>8269</S>, and their priests<S>3548</S>, and their prophets<S>5030</S>,
Saying<S>559</S> to a stock<S>6086</S>, Thou art my father<S>1</S>; and to a stone<S>68</S>, Thou hast brought me forth<S>3205</S>: for they have turned<S>6437</S> their back<S>6203</S> unto me, and not their face<S>6440</S>: but in the time<S>6256</S> of their trouble<S>7451</S> they will say<S>559</S>, Arise<S>6965</S>, and save<S>3467</S> us. <sup>brought: or, begotten me</sup> <sup>their back: Heb. the hinder part of the neck</sup>
But where are thy gods<S>430</S> that thou hast made<S>6213</S> thee? let them arise<S>6965</S>, if they can save<S>3467</S> thee in the time<S>6256</S> of thy trouble<S>7451</S>: for according to the number<S>4557</S> of thy cities<S>5892</S> are thy gods<S>430</S>, O Judah<S>3063</S>. <sup>trouble: Heb. evil</sup>
Wherefore will ye plead<S>7378</S> with me? ye all have transgressed<S>6586</S> against me, saith<S>5002</S> the LORD<S>3068</S>.
In vain<S>7723</S> have I smitten<S>5221</S> your children<S>1121</S>; they received<S>3947</S> no correction<S>4148</S>: your own sword<S>2719</S> hath devoured<S>398</S> your prophets<S>5030</S>, like a destroying<S>7843</S> lion<S>738</S>.
O generation<S>1755</S>, see<S>7200</S> ye the word<S>1697</S> of the LORD<S>3068</S>. Have I been a wilderness<S>4057</S> unto Israel<S>3478</S>? a land<S>776</S> of darkness<S>3991</S>? wherefore say<S>559</S> my people<S>5971</S>, We are lords<S>7300</S>; we will come<S>935</S> no more unto thee? <sup>We are: Heb. We have dominion</sup>
Can a maid<S>1330</S> forget<S>7911</S> her ornaments<S>5716</S>, or a bride<S>3618</S> her attire<S>7196</S>? yet my people<S>5971</S> have forgotten<S>7911</S> me days<S>3117</S> without number<S>4557</S>.
Why trimmest<S>3190</S> thou thy way<S>1870</S> to seek<S>1245</S> love<S>160</S>? therefore hast thou also taught<S>3925</S> the wicked ones<S>7451</S> thy ways<S>1870</S>.
Also in thy skirts<S>3671</S> is found<S>4672</S> the blood<S>1818</S> of the souls<S>5315</S> of the poor<S>34</S> innocents<S>5355</S>: I have not found<S>4672</S> it by secret search<S>4290</S>, but upon all these. <sup>secret: Heb. digging</sup>
Yet thou sayest<S>559</S>, Because I am innocent<S>5352</S>, surely his anger<S>639</S> shall turn<S>7725</S> from me. Behold, I will plead<S>8199</S> with thee, because thou sayest<S>559</S>, I have not sinned<S>2398</S>.
Why gaddest thou about<S>235</S> so much<S>3966</S> to change<S>8138</S> thy way<S>1870</S>? thou also shalt be ashamed<S>954</S> of Egypt<S>4714</S>, as thou wast ashamed<S>954</S> of Assyria<S>804</S>.
Yea, thou shalt go forth<S>3318</S> from him, and thine hands<S>3027</S> upon thine head<S>7218</S>: for the LORD<S>3068</S> hath rejected<S>3988</S> thy confidences<S>4009</S>, and thou shalt not prosper<S>6743</S> in them.
